header: update 1-research alert-jp morgan cuts j&j to neutral
body:
Oct 29 (Reuters) - J.P. Morgan Securities downgraded Johnson & Johnson Inc’s (JNJ.N) stock to “neutral” from “overweight”, on valuation and concerns that the drug maker will be hard pressed to grow earnings in 2009 as several of its most profitable drugs are in the process of becoming generic.

The brokerage expects the company’s pharma business to fall 8 percent to 9 percent in the fourth quarter, and 9 percent to 10 percent in 2009.

Beyond 2009, the brokerage expects J&J’s growth to reaccelerate based on its bullishness on several products in J&J’s pipeline and sees sales growth of 1.8 percent in 2010 and 5.3 percent in 2011 for the pharma business.

Shares of Johnson & Johnson closed at $64.19 Tuesday on Nasdaq. (Reporting by Jennifer Robin Raj in Bangalore; Editing by Amitha Rajan)
